definition: to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise adevice for getting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代办顾问发起校订者想出一个根除败行的计谋。

sentences.english: Liu Xin revised The Classic of Mountains and Rivers, which contributed to the wide spreading in Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 刘歆的校订对于扩大《山海经》在两汉传播亦有贡献。

sentences.english: She sat at her typewriter all night tooling up the final draft.
sentences.chinese: 她整夜坐在打字机帝，校订成稿。

sentences.english: Could you do me a favor and proofread my resume before I send it out to the human recources department?
sentences.chinese: 我把简历寄给人力资料部之前，你能辅佐校订一下吗？

sentences.english: The vice-agent proposed the reviser to devise a computer device for getting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照料建议校订者想出一个废除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: On the English Wikipedia, criteria exist to govern the use of RevisionDelete, which are outlined below.
sentences.chinese: 允许管理员在依据校订标准下使用。

sentences.english: The vice-mechanic suggested the reviser to devise a computer device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照拂建议校订者想出一个铲除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: Red flag market grows shadow opposite, 45 in cent is proofreaded.
sentences.chinese: 红旗街长影对过，45平分校订个。

sentences.english: The vice-mechsomeic prescribed the reviser to devise a computer device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照拂建议校订者想出一个革除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: Study the corrections and edits on your paper.
sentences.chinese: 研究订正之处，并校订你的文章。

sentences.english: I have revised the work and highlighted my revisions in yellow.
sentences.chinese: 我已经校阅此篇并将我校订的地方以黄色标示出来。

sentences.english: The vice-advisor directed the reviser to devise a computer device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照拂建议校订者想出一个废除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: The revised file and associated holy image as sent by him are attached.
sentences.chinese: 此校订版及由他传来的此篇相关圣相一并附呈。

sentences.english: You’ve got feedback on your ebook and revised it
sentences.chinese: 你已经得到回复，并且校订它。

definition: to proofread/to revise one or more editions of a text using an authoritative edition as a source book/to editorially revise a text
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to collate and annotate/(on book titles) collated and annotated
to go to press/to submit for printing
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
